alert.note: Alert for Kennebec (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 23 at 11:04AM EST until December 25 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Gray ME has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Maine... Kennebec River At Skowhegan affecting Somerset and Kennebec Counties. Kennebec River At North Sidney affecting Kennebec County. Kennebec River At Augusta affecting Kennebec County. Kennebec River at Hallowell affecting Sagadahoc and Kennebec Counties. For the Kennebec River...including Skowhegan, North Sidney, Augusta, Hallowell...Minor up to Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kennebec River at Augusta. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Much of the parking lot on Front Street in Augusta floods. At 17.0 feet, Water reaches the back of some buildings on Water Street in Augusta. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:48 AM EST Friday the stage was 4.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 7.6 feet this afternoon. It will then fall to 6.8 feet and begin rising again this evening. It will rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue to rise to 16.5 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
